newsitem.title: UK: Palm oil slightly higher on quiet European market.
newsitem.headline: Palm oil slightly higher on quiet European market.

text.p: Higher Chicago soy oil futures at the end of last week supported palm oil prices in Europe on Monday morning.
However, the market was quiet with most of Europe closed for the Whitsun holiday.
UK based traders received little help from the Malaysian market where business was quiet ahead of the release by Malaysian cargo surveyor SGS of its export data for May 1-20.
Crude palm oil sellers were $5 to $2.50 up while products were unchanged to $2.50 higher.
In limited trading May RBD palm oil traded at $551.50, Jun olein at $584 and May stearin at $410 a tonne fob Malaysian ports.
Lauric oils were not quoted, but traders said the outlook for coconut oil remains bearish.
No guilder based products were quoted,
